Package implementations

Class Parser

java.lang.Object
implementations.Parser
public class Parser extends Object
The class that manages the parsing process of the .xml file

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Parser(String fileName)
    Constructor for a Parser Stores a File object using the filename entered to then parse later

  • Constructor Details

    • Parser

      public Parser(String fileName)
      Constructor for a Parser Stores a File object using the filename entered to then parse later
      Parameters:
      fileName - is the name of the .xml file in the res folder

  • Method Details

    • parsingXML

      public void parsingXML() throws FileNotFoundException, EmptyQueueException
      The main parsing methodc It uses a scanner object to read the file stored in the parser it stores tags created by the processLine() method and then passes each one to the tagValidation() method to determine errors which are finally displayed by the errorLog method if any are found
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - if the file fails to open or is not found
      EmptyQueueException - if the queues are empty

    • processLine

      public MyArrayList<Tag> processLine(String line, int lineNumber)
      Reads through a line in the xml file an returns all found tags within the line
      Parameters:
      line - the line being parsed through
      lineNumber - the current line number for error displays
      Returns:
      an array of tags to later validate

    • tagValidation

      public void tagValidation(Tag tag) throws EmptyQueueException
      This method checks if the tags are opening, closing or ignorable. If they are opening tags the are pushed on to the stack, then the last pushed opening tag is compared to the closing tag and if they are the same there are no errors, otherwise the tags are checked through to see where the errors are made and stored in the queues
      Parameters:
      tag - the tag that is currently being validated
      Throws:
      EmptyQueueException - if the queue is empty

    • errorLog

      public void errorLog() throws EmptyQueueException
      This method checks for any errors after the validation process, it pops and dequeues remaining tags from the stack and queues and displays an error message for each by calling reportErrors(). This method's algorithm also prevents duplicate errors from being displayed
      Throws:
      EmptyQueueException - if the queue is empty

    • reportErrors

      public void reportErrors() throws EmptyQueueException
      This method displays the errors for any remaining tags in either queue
      Throws:
      EmptyQueueException - if the queue is empty

    • printError

      public void printError(Object message)
      Simplifies displaying error messages syntax
      Parameters:
      message - that which will be displayed
